com.topcoder.shared.netCommon
Interface CustomSerializable

public interface CustomSerializable

Custom serializability is enabled by the class implementing the CustomSerializable interface. The class that implements the CustomSerializable interface must be public and must have a public no-arg constructor.

During custom serialization the customWriteObject() is called. The customWriteObject method is responsible for writing the state of the object.

During custom deserialization first we construct an object using a public no-arg constructor. Then we invoke the customReadObject method that is responsible for restoring the state of the object.

Author:
Timur Zambalayev
See Also:
CSReader, CSWriter

Method Summary
 void customReadObject(CSReader reader)
          Restores the state of the object from the reader.
 void customWriteObject(CSWriter writer)
          Writes the state of the object to the writer.
 

Method Detail

customWriteObject

public void customWriteObject(CSWriter writer)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Writes the state of the object to the writer. The state of the object could be later restored with the customReadObject method.
Parameters:
writer - the writer to write to.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error has occurred in the stream that backs the writer.

customReadObject

public void customReadObject(CSReader reader)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.io.ObjectStreamException
Restores the state of the object from the reader. The state of the object was previously written by the customWriteObject method.
Parameters:
reader - the reader to read from.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error has occurred in the stream that backs the reader.
java.io.ObjectStreamException - if the information that is read is inconsistent (stream corrupted or incompatibility between writers and readers)
